page.title: 17RELIGION AT SANDHEAD
page.content: The church in Sandhead is relatively modern, having been built in the 1960s to serve a growing community in the village. It is the youngest of 3 churches which serve the Parish of Stoneykirk in which our block stands. Miss Weir of Balgreggan Estate was very generous in her support for the building of this church. The churches are served by one minister, who lives in a new manse built near the church. He is also the school chaplain and services are held in the school at the end of each month with special services in the church at the end of each term. The minister preaches at two of the 3 churches each Sunday, turns being taken to miss a service, and because of the distances involved the minister needs a car. The village also has a Gospel Hall which is used by a sect called Plymouth Bretheren.
